articles.title: Data
articles.contents:
Preliminaries
The sustainability office of the University of Basel provided us with a multiple databases containing information of the University’s historical electronic research output (publications and funded projects).
These data have been preprocessed in the following way:
Publications
Included journal articles (N = 43,229), book items (chapters, 13,443), journal items (5,028), proceeding items (2,144), and books (1,897).
Selected publications with English titles (~85%) and DOI present (~80%) that were published between 2010 and 2020 (~60%). About half of all publications remained.
Identified abstracts for all publications using rscopus. About ~85% of abstracts could be retrieved.
Publications & Projects
Identified faculty-level organizational unit within the University of Basel (including associated and cross-disciplinary institutes) for each item.
Using translations of the SDG queries of the Aurora network and the corpustools R package, detected wether titles or abstracts were SDG-relevant.
Data
The data is shared via this Github repository.
Publications columns
Variable
Description
type
Type of publication.
year
Year of publication.
authors
Author list of publication.
title
Title of publication.
abstract
Abstract of publication.
outlet
Name of journal, book, or proceedings publication.
peer_reviewed
Has publication been subjected to peer review.
organisation
Original list of Unibas organizations involved in publication.
unibas_authors
Publication authors at University of Basel.
unibas_publcation
Publication offically affiliated with University of Basel. (?)
doi
Digital object identfier
Org-*
Logical vectors indicating Unibas faculty-level organizations involved in publication.
SDG-*
Logical vectors indicating whether publication addresses the 17 sustainable development goals.
Projects columns
Variable
Description
lead
Name of project lead researcher.
co_lead
Names of project co-lead researchers.
organisation
Original list of Unibas organizations involved in project
title
Title of project.
year
Year of project start.
abstract
Abstract of project.
keywords
Keywords of project.
type
Type of project: self- or externally financed.
status
Active or Completed
id
Internal idenifier number
Org-*
Logical vectors indicating Unibas faculty-level organizations involved in project.
SDG-*
Logical vectors indicating whether publication addresses the 17 sustainable development goals.

articles.title: Hackathon
articles.description: Identifying the UN Sustainable Development Goals in University of Basel research output
articles.contents:
Preliminaries
Clone this Github repository.
Part I - Visualizing
Goal
The goal of the first hackathon part is to produce three quality visulializations illustrating…
The frequency distribution of sustainable development goals detected in Unibas publications and projects.
The relationship between sustainable development goals.
The distribution of sustainable development goals detected in Unibas publications and projects as a function of Unibas organizational units.
Rules
Each group creates and works in a single R script that is given a unique name by the group, e.g., a group pseudonym, to not infer with the other group’s script files. The script file is stored in 1_code. See code template including the placehold GROUPPSEUDONYM.
Each group creates three .pdf figures files in the 2_figures folder. Figure files also must receive a suffix identifying the group. See example figure.
Pull before you Push.
Part II - Reporting
tba

articles.title: CDS Hackathon
articles.description: Identifying the UN Sustainable Development Goals in University of Basel research output
articles.contents:
This is the home of the 2021 UN Sustainability Development Goal Hackathon of the Center for Cognitive and Decision Sciences, University of Basel.
Learn more about the event on the Data, Hackathon, and Report pages.

 from en.unesco.org
